topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.1 Beta: Managing Server Groups

body.p: From the Titanium Server Admin Guide
Server Groups is a mechanism to group virtual machines to which a common set of attributes is applied.
body.note: This feature applies only to KVM Region servers.

ol.li: Launch the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade Horizon Dashboard.
Select the appropriate region and project.
Click the Admin dashboard, then the System panel, then the Server Groups tab.
In the Server Group table, click Create Server Group.

In the Create Server Group dialog, specify the following information:
Project Select a project to associate the server group.
Server Group Name Specify a name for the new server group.
Policy Select a scheduling policy:
affinity. When this option is selected, new instances launched as part of this server group are scheduled to run on the same compute node.
anti-affinity. When this option is selected, new instances launched as part of this server group are scheduled to run on different compute nodes. For example, you can use the anti-affinity option when you have two virtual machines that run in 1:1 HA protection mode, and you want them to be protected against hardware failures.
Best Effort. Select this option to enforce the policy in place, affinity, or anti-affinity, on a best-effort basis. If for any reason the policy cannot be enforced, then the deployment of the new instance proceeds using the regular scheduling. When cleared, the policy in place must be executable for the new instance to be scheduled. Launching of a new virtual machine fails if there are no resources to comply with the selected policy.
Max Group Size (Instances). Determines the maximum number of instances that can co-exist as part of this server group.

body.p: You can add instance to a server group as you create the instance.
